text: Good location. Friendly and welcoming place.Negatives: Lounge seats booked by guests early in the morning.

I enjoy visiting a spa while on vacation and this one wasn't too far from where I was staying. Simply put my treatment (volcano scrub) is one of the best I've ever had. I'm only sad we don't live nearby!After the treatment we stayed for lunch at the hotel's restaurant. Lovely view while we were there, and the food was great.

I have been several times in Viseu in another Hotel of this Group. This time I wanted to try the 5* of the Group, and I was quite disappointed.The room honestly did not give me the 5 * comfort (compared to other hotels in this category.) Towels looked rather worn, no longer \fluffy.\" The spare bed was rather fragile
month: but for a 6 year old it was still enough.At breakfast the regular cafe only is \"sack cafe\"
year: the breakfast buffet in my opinion quite weak. When the orange juice ran out
extracted_date: hot water for the tea was only lukewarm. Just like the scrambled eggs and the bottle sausage.Conclusion
year_int: Price / quality is not in accordance. Price yes 5 *
sentiment_score: but the quality at most 4 *.By sure I will not make this \"experience\" again."

text: Located on a beautiful place, all the zones of the hotel are really nice and the ambient is very calm and chill - perfect for some days of relax. The restaurant is incredible with a great wine selection too. We really loved it! It's only a bit hard to arrive but actually once you get how to go there makes the place feel even better.

Good location and views. 2min walking from the beach Porto de Mos and 5min driving to center of Lagos. A kind of small resort with few extra things. Boring for kids (mine is 3) though. Price quality a little bit exagerated, and that is maybe why there were no Portuguese guests? Overall good.

Found these wonderful apartments over 30 years ago. Have been back 15 times since. Children always insisted we returned. Poll fantastic, apartments well furnished and large,balcony spacious and with great views. Very well run.

Positives:Check in was quick and easy and our cases were taken to our room which was a nice touch.The hotel is big and has a great multi sports area and the slides are also good.The staff are friendly and responsive.The rooms are big, tidy, clean and quiet during the night times (built well and no room noises coming through).The pool bar was great.The food buffet was small but actually the quality was better than expected.Drinks selection was also pretty good.The guests - this is a family oriented hotel and all the guests were respectful of that - no bad behaviour.The negatives:Main one is location. It‚Äôs a good 20 min walk to the beach or the old town.The nightclub strip which is 5 mins way is an eye sore - great if you are here to party but not so great if you are here with family. I was up running at 6:30am every day and there were still people staggering around the strip drinking and rubbish and the smell of pi@@ everywhere.The gym doesn‚Äôt have anywhere near enough equipment for a hotel of this size and only has 1 working running machine (although I told reception on the first day that one machine was broken - still not fixed 6 days later)Entertainment for teenagers was a little sparse in the evening. Only a small outside area for a singer and the indoor bar felt more like a waiting room. Needs a bit more mood lighting and music.The in-house paid for restaurants are not good enough to warrant spending additional money. They should ditch them and use those areas for something else.The pool is cold and uncomfortable even when the sun is bearing down on you.There isn‚Äôt enough umbrellas for the sun beds and although there is plenty of space, you have the same people abusing the towel reserves everyday - putting towels down and disappearing down the beach until 4pm - totally out of order and the hotel should police it and have signs up to warn that towels will be taken after say 2hrs. All Sun loungers were reserved by 9am. I was up 6:30am running everyday and towels had already been put down around the pool at that time. So be prepared.Conclusion:I wouldn‚Äôt return - the area isn‚Äôt for me. The Hotel ticks lots of boxes and would be great for younger families. Those with teenagers may find it a little limiting.They say it‚Äôs a 5 Star Plus - well it‚Äôs not. I stay in 6 Star Hotels in Dubai all the time and it makes hotel seems like a 2/3 Star. In context of other Spanish hotels of similar standard, I would say this is a lower 4 Star Hotel.

Had a great time, we were sad to be leaving üòî. Looking forward to coming back.Loved all the entertainment and things to do in and around the hotel. A short walk down to the strip was also an eye opener and plenty to do for all ages.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Oeiras By IHG
text: We have stayed at this hotel a couple of times, but have always noticed that desk staff are not the least bit interested in their customers.  Most now speak English which is good.Morning breakfast seemed to be less than prior visits.The biggest downside of this hotel is that their are not any decent restaurants around . You have to drive out to the Plaza to get a restaurant, or get on the highway to go to one of the nearest towns.

Hotel is absolutely fantastic. After reading previous reviews regarding food, these people obviously wouldn't know a whatnot food was as the food here is fantastic. There is something for everyone. We are all inclusive and came with the idea of eating out a few night, yet we leave tomorrow and are yet to eat anywhere else. The staff have been wonderful and so helpful. The apartments are fantastic, and well equipped. The bar and restaurant staff have been great and are fantastic with our kids. We will definitely be back here again and would recommend to anyone looking for a 5* break!!!

A very special note for Patrick, without a doubt the best Bartender of all, always very friendly, with a smile on his face, speaking Portuguese, and always available to help.Patrick was a huge help in providing the best vacation possible for me and my family.His friendliness is priceless, thank you very much for all your service.

Why would you want to stay outside the city centre if you are coming to see Porto? That was my thought when I realized this hotel is in Antas. But the hotel made up for it! The spaces were carefully decorated and all details in the rooms were top class: the linen, the towels and so on. Manuela and Joao were amazing hosts who made heartly breakfasts. The last night when we needed a little snack, we got a full serving of local specialities in the garden. And yes, the Uber trips to the centre were super easy and cost between 5-10 euros for theee persons. Warm recommendations for Antas House!

This is an honest review on our experience, we had high expectations given the rating of this hotel and when we choose all inclusive we always ensure we go above 4 star for the quality of the food, which was not the case here - the all inclusive was of a 3 star standard. Whilst there was always something to eat, the food was not representative of the lovely portuguese food in local restaurants, the service eg replenishing of food was poor, drinks were ok, there was no coffee included except for instant coffee in machines, there was a lack of ice cream (only small tubs included) and slush puppies for the kids.  When we spoke to the manager about this we were told that it was value for money. I think this depends on expectations and I have definitely had better value for money in other hotels. The Italian restaurant in the hotel was shut for the end of the season and it felt as if the hotel was shutting down, which I understand it was. We didnt venture to the other restaurants which were included which could have been more authentic/better quality.  We were very disappointed by lack of fresh coffee which we have had in much lower star hotels and no bottled water except one bottle on the first day. On a positive note the outdoor BBQ was good for lunch around the pool and all the staff always served with a smile and there was always something to eat in the restaurant. I also found the food to be of a good temperature.Rooms were ok, they are a great size but again the quality is not 5 star. There was no special toiletries, they had one shower gel/shampoo for all uses, they were great for a self catered 3 star apartment and this is what I think the hotel should be rated as. We had to request some of the items eg slippers that were said to be included. It was very odd that it said there were tea and coffee facilities but no actual tea and coffee included although when I did request this it was responded to straight away (although no milk and again instant coffee).Facilities, the one thing that I think really does set the hotel above the rest is the indoor spa. Sometimes the cleanliness could have been higher, but this really was a great asset having the pool, jacuzzi, sauna and steam room included and this does set the hotel above the rest. The outdoor pool was nice and clean, and the entertainment was good. It was a shame some of the competitions didn't have suitable prizes for kids (my daughter won the bingo but was given a bottle of wine for mum...the same wine available on the all inclusive ü§£)I would also like to positively comment on the service, whenever I had an issue it was responded to straight away. A special mention to Carlos who arranged both of my girls to have special gifts arranged for them in the room and really did go above and beyond.Locally, I would recommend the Marina for a lovely drink and food (tasca Portuguesa was lovely) and we also had a great boat ride there and saw the dolphins and caves (arranged by Carlos at the front desk).We won't be back - I don't think all inclusive is for us here, but I think if you are expecting 3 star and/or you come here self catered and enjoy the spa, you won't be disappointed.

Super friendly staff, lovely hotel.Room was good with big bathroom. We were on side overlooking road and there was building works / traffic noise when we had the balcony door open, however once shut couldn‚Äôt hear anything! Bathroom was large with really hot waterfall shower.Location - wise it is quite near the Martim Moniz area which has a lot of single men hanging around on the streets. We were 2 women and walked around fine both during the day and at night with no issues. The hotel is a 2 minute walk from Intendente metro and about a 20 minute walk from the main town shopping area. We also used Ubers which were very cheap!The staff at the hotel were some of the nicest I have ever come across, they were so friendly and helpful! Breakfast was included which we used most days - continental buffet and then other hot items such as eggs / pancakes on request.Overall staying at the 1908 Lisboa hotel was fantastic.

hotel_name: Pine Cliffs Ocean Suites, A Luxury Collection Resort & Spa
text: For starters, the property itself and location is spectacular.  But... rooms are not suites.  They're 1 bedroom with a very awkward bathroom separated by a glass door.  Not sure why they call them suites - they're not.  Service at the hotel was pretty good (not great) and the food was incredibly disappointing.  Overall, a nice experience give the location and views, but not what you'd expect from a Luxury Collection.
The dancarinos spectacular very nice exp√©rience maravilhosa very nice yoandry,cinder,nirma,leyanna eu choreographer Lauro

We went on a 5 night City break with another couple Every thing about our stay was a thoroughly enjoyable experience, the hotel was spotlessl throughout the staff were very helpful and friendly the breakfast buffet was varied and plentiful. The location was ideal as everywhere was within  walking distance to everywhere. Would definitely return at some time.

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Ch√¢teaux
text: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Valverde for 3 nights in mid-July and LOVED every minute of our stay.Upon check-in, we knew that we had found a wonderful gem.  The entire staff was outstanding, kind and helpful.  The little hotel is very pretty with a courtyard for brunch, cocktails, swimming and some entertainment (Fado was delightful).  Our room, 502, facing Avenida da Liberdade was wonderful, quiet and elegant.  The location is perfect.The iPhone provided to each guest while in Lisbon was a great touch and very helpful.   The bed was great and the bathroom so nice as well.There could be better light in the bathroom, as it felt a wee bit dark.  Only other constructive criticism was the AC, which definitely could have been stronger.The breakfast was delicious and again, each and every staff member were wonderful and one could not ask for anything better.  When we are back in Lisbon, we will definitely be back!!

This hostel is just great!! It's not like other hostels - the equipment and decoration is very nice and special (it's all about the comic character \Corto Maltese\"). We had a lift from the airport to the hostel for free and stayed 5 nights in the \"family room\". There's absolutely nothing to complain about! The staff is extremely friendly and you feel like being at home! There's a huge kitchen with everything you need and every day fresh fruits and chocolate in the living room. A sunny garden and a winter-garden provide enough space to relax und sit together. The Captain's brunch is amazing! You get rolls and cookies
column16: scrambled eggs - everything! They offer some bikes for free and you can leave your surf stuff in the garage. I give the advise to talk a lot to the staff - they can tell you much about Peniche
column17: Baleal and Portugal if you're interested. They also offer you a drive to the supermarket. If you need surf lessons or wanna do yoga they work together with the Drop-Surfschool which is just a 2-min-walk away from the hostel. The beach is 5 mins away. All in all this is the best hostel! Price and offer are super - I will obviously come back some day!Greets to Z√© & Sabs - you're just amazing! :-)"

text: This is a lovely hotel- as you‚Äôd expect from a Marriott- very attentive and courteous staff, good size rooms, comfortable beds, lovely gardens and a superb breakfast. I did think in fact while I was there how you could be anywhere in the world as the carpets, paintings on the walls, general d√©cor is pretty standard.I was here on business as it has great conference facilities and all went very smoothly (I had additionally arranged a side meeting myself) but not sure how convenient it would be for tourists as it‚Äôs roughly a 20-30 minute taxi ride into town.Sitting out in the garden by the pool or the terrace with a glass of wine is wonderfully relaxing.

The apartments are large, clean and comfortable. a nice balcony, the furniture is dated, but the price is accordingly. Anyway, we were not looking for new furniture etc., but a nice, quiet and comfortable place. And that we got! Although Albufeira is a holiday madhouse  we were in between 'the Strip' and the village center itself, close to the beach, and no noise from the bars and restaurants. Both centers are about 10 minutes walk, with lots of good and cheap restaurants. Also in the vicinity of the hotel there were several good restaurants.There is a good minimarket next door, with fresh bread every morning.The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. there is a good swimming pool, with sufficient beds to sun on. Free Wifi is available in the lobby, next to the reception.To summarize, we had a good three weeks holiday for a very reasonable price.
Superb new hotelImpeccable serviceVery good quality of equipment and beddingNoisy despite the quality of the windows (plane, train, traffic on the nearby bridge)I still recommend

Great experience at Lisbon, first trip to Portugal, very helpful staff, very warm, great breakfast buffet, club it with the room tariff. Close to the zoo and metro. Close to city centre, cab 10 minutes. Great housekeeping and staff are just brilliant.

Perfectly placed off the best street in Lisbon. Super Spa, swimming pool sun roof, great friendly staff honestly trying to make you love Lisbon, and most important wonderful bed to drift off in after a day of looking at magical castles, interesting dinner menu in this  newly opened hotel.Lisbon is popping. On its way up again.Come you will not be dissapointed.

Very stylish hotel on the banks of the Tagus River and well connected to public transport (tram 15 E). Our room with river view was spacious with balcony, coffee and tea making facilities, TV, bathrobes, minibar and well equipped bathroom. The bed was about 250 cm wide. After 3 nights I pointed out the perforated bedsheet and the uncleaned balcony since moving in. Unfortunately, only the duvet was responded to and we received an apology. Breakfast rich and with lactose-free dairy products.  Wellness and sports area cost extra. Outrageously, I found a waitress who didn't dignify us in the evening. So I went to the counter to ask for salt and pepper. She then regulated that we should do this exclusively through her. Value for money not appropriate.
Beautiful experienceWe'll definitely be back.Very nice rooms and pools , expensive restaurant on the other hand for an average food

I had an amazing week in their hostel in Lagos! My best surf trip so far. Definitely. The hosts are awesome! I had great time at BBQs and in other parties at the surf hostel - the geek night was lot of fun! Night life in Lagos is amazing and hanging out with these guys made it even better.Surf teachers are great and I really improved a lot in surfing during my stay even though I had surfed before.The hostel is big, clean and really cosy and the breakfasts are great! The hostel itself is a great place to spend time in. They even have two guitars there ‚Äì thanks for great jams :DMoreover, Lagos is a really nice town and Algarve Surf Hostel is the place to stay. Thank you guys, I'm really looking forward to my next visit which, I hope, might be already in August.And You, spend the craziest surf trip in Algarve Surf Hostel and meet a lot of new nice people!

Stayed in one of the two bedroom townhouses with roof terrace which I thought were good. English tv is limited i.e. one channel bbc world news. But the tv had netflix, amazon etc. Be aware that  one section of apartments is very close to the main beach road so has significant road and foot traffic going past. Noisy on occasions might bother some light sleepers. The apartments effected are on both sides of the main entrance to the hotel block E being the one on the left. Ubers are excellent. If you hire a car and intend to refuel at the petrol station at the airport we found everyone had the same idea and chaos in action. So give yourselves 15mins if you're looking to do this.

Wonderful hotel with excellent personnel.Design is incredible, but room`s shower without door , doesn`t seem to be ergonomic as humidity in room is depends on it then.  I believe bathroom should be split from main room especially when you travel with someone.Service on high level. The staff do their best job.Location is good, you have perfect view on ocean and clifs, so you can meet sunset. Nearby you can find beach.

We booked a kind of studio with a small kitchen. We were surprised how nice and clean it was, top furnished and quiet with hammer views of the sea. (rarely seen such a clean hotel/room)Very friendly staff from check in to service room and bar/restaurant. Thank you so much!Breakfast was excellent with great choice and it was always replenished. A small pool which was very clean.The food in the evening was more fast food based as the main kitchen is closed in the evening. We only consumed something small once. The drinks were great and very friendly staff.I would book here again anytime.

I choose this hotel because I didn't want to stay in Funchal. The expectations were high but they were exceeded. This is one of the best 5 stars hotel that I've stayed in Portugal. Loved the room and the details with the cot, huge bed, fruit was delivered in out arrival and every day they bought candys to the room and the house cleaning even folded out baby clothes in a very cute way. The breakfast is really really good, a lot of variety, they even have traditional cake from Madeira. We have lunch at the pool bar once (a lot of vegan options) and have dinner every day (the food from the buffet was always different, starts, deserts, etc). I loved the kids room (I have a 9 month daughter, she played a lot in the pool with the slide and the little balls). the outdoor space is amazing, a lot of pools and space. The only con is that the indoor pool water could be a little warmer. Outside the hotel one can simply go to the marina and have a nice walk. Hope I can go back again soon.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Quite the institution this place. There were six somewhat snooty doormen/concierges/bellhop said when we arrived,all trying to look busy with nothing much to do. Check in was efficient but we had to wait ages for our room despite arriving around 3pm. I thought they might offer us a drink while we hung around but no such luck. 5.5euros for a tiny beer makes the bar expensive and that's one of the issues with this place; no one sits around having a drink presumably partly to do with the cost. It's like the Marie Celeste! They did lay on a cocktail evening where you got a glass of fizzy and there was a classical music evening with a free drink but other than that the place is dead. The Cliff Bay next door has a happy hour every evening and this was a better bet for sundowners. Breakfast in RP was very good apart from two days where the \muesli\" (really a bircher) which was normally delicious
month: tasted as if it had fermented. We complained and fresh batch was brought but it should be made every evening for the next morning. Interesting place to see but we wouldn't go back."

date: Christian lund Pwrote a review Jul 2016
text: If you want a room here get one with a view. Everything is pretty standard for Hotels in this region, however the view is something special. An added bonus is that no other Hotels can be seen from the pool, as it is surrounded by cliffs and ocean. Everything is a bit old and the rooms would do well with a bit of renovation, but everything works as intended. Staff seem friendly enough.

The stunning views from all areas of the resort are only one reason to stay at Tivoli Carvoeiro. The relaxing feel in the spacious areas throughout the resort are perfect for a holiday. The resort location is situated so you can do many day trips to small towns or historic sites and return without hurrying.Food is good, rooms and balcony are well maintained, staff are very helpful and speak English well. We will return.

Amazing location!! Had an Indian wedding here within the family. Brilliant staff, amazing views and just pure perfection! Sky bar is a must see too, the rooms are beautiful and you are definitely paying for quality.

We have stayed at the Royal Savoy many times.  It as that traditional luxury Madeiran feel and style.  The hotel as an extensive pool area with two large outdoor pools and one indoor.  There is also a sea swimming dock.  There plenty of seating and sun shades, so none of the silly bickering over pool furniture.  The whole hotel is immaculately maintained.  The rooms or suites, we have stayed in both, are excellent. The piano bar is a great place to start or end a evening in Funchal.  It has been a few years now since they knocked down the old Savoy.  Nothing much seems to be happening behind the fenced off construction site.  It is a same, because the gardens are no longer available for guests.  We found the staff and the service level excellent as always.

From flawless check in, through wonderful service from housekeeping, breakfasts to die for (absolutely spoilt for choice) to efficient check out - simply perfect venue for an indulgent Madeiran escape

Came to this place for dinner. Service was super friendly, the waiter went out of his way to explain the hotel and concept for us, their vision on the food etc. My dad being from this part of Portugal and not into ‚Äúmodern food‚Äù wasn‚Äôt too amused of the place and especially not its prices. (He knows that you can eat for half the price in many restaurants in the villages around and get traditional food). The waiter sensed it and took extra care to explain to him a few things and have some chitchat to see if he would enjoy the evening nonetheless. We all ate really well, my meat was not medium like I asked but more well done apart from that it was good. Is it worth the prices they ask? In all honesty, you can eat better and for less in that area, I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs fair asking Dutch prices in a small village in Portugal... and when you do make it incredible, and it wasn‚Äôt. To me this says: tourists can afford it, tourists are used to pay it so let‚Äôs go for it. 25 euros for the steak was even for me a bit of a tourist trap price. In the end I chose to eat there so I can‚Äôt blame them for it, hence the 4 stars

We had a perfectly acceptable time here.The rooms were nice, clean and spacious and the service was good.  Staff were friendly and helpful.The food was mediocre.  The breakfast was plentiful but only average and the supper was not great for the price.The pool was small and shallow which is fine for adults but the kids wanted more.It was quite expensive per night and we expected more for being rated a five star hotel.

Booked 4 nights at the Crowne Plaza Vilamoura for 50th birthday.. Very friendly hotel, clean comfortable with good food and service. Went for Half Board with low expectations to eat out on most nights.. However that was not the case as ate in the hotel for all but one night. Although buffet for both breakfast and evening meal there was plenty of choice for both hot and cold selections, with each evening selection was different. wine waiters were helpful in choosing the plonk. For those that have not seen on the booking sites the rear direct entrance to the beach is closed at present while they build a new promenade., did not affect view, nor did it cause increased noise that was noticed. Rooms very clean and comfortable. we had 4th floor with side sea view. (fantastic view of sea and sunsets) Glass bathroom panels were novel , potentially fun for the adventurous out there. (electric blind to seal glass bathroom panel for those who wanted to be more private). Being out of season very quiet for people which we enjoyed. places we liked were The Brewery on the marina for a evening beer/wine, Akvavit restaurant - fantastic food and service, and for those with energy to burn - walk through to Quarteira and then up the beautiful sandy beach to Vale Do Lobo, where you can enjoy a drink and some food at sandals restaurant.( be aware 11km each way but worth it). Overall great break, location, people and weather. recommend to all.Bad points, The adjacent Casino is for people who like to smell like an ashtray, and the only gripe for the hotel was they also have an area near the bar area for smokers. not very 20th century.

We stayed in this hotel for 10 nights. It is a historical mansion just a 10 minute (up hill) walk from Sintras city centre with great views on Castelo dos Mouros.Rooms are very clean. Some parts might need some restauration but I think that is the charm of an old building.Breakfast is simple but good with fresh products every day. There is parkingspace (if you manage to drive uphill). Staff is very friendly and helpfull.Normally I would rate a hotel of this kind with four stars.The reason for the fifth star is the very friendly service of the staff and manager.We found our room filled with snacks and drinks for the children and a bottle of wine for the adults. Every day fresh botteld water was placed in our room without charging anything. A taxi service to and from the airport was arranged and the manager called us especialy to see if we had not payed to much.It was a great stay and I can recommend this hotel to any oneThank you Jeroen and Tomas (and all other staff)

This is still a lovely hotel and ideally situated for exploring the marina and other parts of the algarve using the local bus service which stops not far from the hotel. However, there were a couple of things this time which didn‚Äôt quite come up to scratch.Firstly the hotel management in their wisdom have decided to change the lovely rattan sunbeds with mattresses to very ordinary plain white metal ones. The funniest thing is that orders were given to change them during the day whilst people were sunbathing. One minute you were relaxing on the rattan one, the next minute you were asked to move and given a white one. Not a great move and the new ones (despite costing ‚Ç¨200 each) are very poor in comparison to the others.We also found housekeeping to be very inefficient on this occasion. Most days our room wasn‚Äôt serviced until late afternoon and then when it was done, it appeared rushed. We were there 7 nights and I‚Äôm certain that the sheets weren‚Äôt changed throughout. There are staff falling over themselves at breakfast and yet hardly a housekeeper to be seen.There‚Äôs only one easy chair on the balcony so difficult to enjoy a pre dinner drink on your balcony as one of you has to stay inside unless you drag a chair out onto the balcony.Whilst we were there sadly we weren‚Äôt blessed with great weather so I wanted to use the indoor pool. However I really object to paying a further ‚Ç¨11 per day for the privilege. Surely this should be included in the room rate, after all it‚Äôs not a cheap hotel to stay in.I feel like I‚Äôm doing nothing but moan but I would stay at this hotel again. I just feel that things are generally not as good as a year ago.

date: Carmen Ma Mwrote a review Dec 2023
text: The theme nights were great to make our stay at the hotel more pleasant. Specifically, we had a very pleasant time dancing salsa, bachata and merengue. Professor Yoandry and his colleagues made us spend an unforgettable evening.

Unfortunately, there is a building under construction in front of the hotel üò© with incessant noise üî®ü™öüö®We asked to be able to at least have a room in the same category but not in front of the building under construction. The manager told us to pay extra for the same room but not on the noisy side. It's uncommercial and purely unacceptable!!! We will not return to the hotel and we strongly advise against it...

We have visited many times, excellent location and lovely pool area.  Good to see that there are so many sun umbrellas available which is a definite improvement on past visits.Another addition is the presence of activities staff around the pool, special mention to Boris for his cocktail making demonstration and his √¢‚Ç¨≈ìBoris√¢‚Ç¨¬ù cocktail, was very nice!All staff we have encountered so far have been very pleasant, but the poolside guy who went out of his way to find a sunbed for an older guest definitely deserves a mention - if this review is picked up by the Management team then this was at the main pool on 14/04/2024.We will definitely be returning in the future.

Natura is a very relaxed complex. The staff are great and friendly. We have just returned after 5 days and loved every minute. Rooms were lovely, clean and bright with a kitchen and bathroom. The hotel is about a 5 to 10 minute walk from the strip and there are some great places to eat opposite the top of the road leading down the Natura.

Situated just off Restauradores Square, a short walk from where the Aerobus drops you this hotel is very well placed.  The Metro is 20m away.  A 5 minute walk will take you to the start of the famous no. 28 tram route. The district of Alfama is also within walking distance.  Plenty of restaurants nearby the hotel.  The reception staff were marvellous! We had bikes in boxes for the Camino and they lent me tools to help assemble them. The maintenance man even got his drill to help mend a broken mudguard.  The room was high up at the back and had a lovely view of the rooftops and the castle.  The breakfast was exceptionally good with fresh fruit, orange juice and eggs cooked how you wanted, lovely Past√©is de Nata (Portuguese custard tarts).  Overall a great experience.

I travelled with my mum for a short break - we really enjoyed it. Hotel was clean and most staff were freindly except for one recpetionist (Aida I think!) she was really rude. Breakfast was good. Had a pool facing room that was in the sun, half the hotel was mainly in the shade so you would need to specify. No tea/cofee making faciliites inthe room so take a travel kettle if you need to. Room service was good too. I woud say that the hotel is suited to the more mature traveller but can imaging there being more families and younger people earlier in the summer. The shops in Tavira were pretty much closed on Sundays - I asked at reception on Friday and was told they didnt shut n sundays so was unable to return and buy things I had seen earlier in the week on my last day. Oh you have to pay 10 euros to use the gym!!

We stayed for 3 nights in one of the Garden Villas. Like a mini apartment it was nice to have the extra space to spread out. Having a washer/dryer was also nice. The staff was beyond helpful, offering coffee when we arrived early, helping make dinner reservations and more. If you're looking for a quiet spot to enjoy the city, I highly recommend here.

This charming hostel is like no other.  It has private rooms with en suites for those who may not want to share facilities.  The building is renovated, modern, clean and charming.  It has a family feel and is located in the heart of this charming fishing village with direct access to the most beautiful and clean beach.  You won't regret staying here!

My husband and I spent 2 nights at Sao Lourenco as part of a larger trip to Portugal for our honeymoon. It was easily the most scenic, beautiful part of our entire trip. The staff was incredibly friendly, the room was beautifully designed and very clean. Every meal we had at the restaurant on the property was delicious. We took advantage of the free bikes and rode them through the olive grove. The next day the front desk fixed us up a picnic and we took it to the oldest olive tree on their property. There was a family of cows sitting in a field across from us as we ate. We also each took a horse riding lesson with Ricardo. My husband enjoyed the sauna for an hour afterwards. If you are thinking or considering booking here, just do it!!

I fell in love with this hotel because of its online photos overlooking the river but in reality it was somewhat of a let down.  The location was good for wandering around the waterfront of Belem but crossing over the railway meant a long walk in either direction.  The contemporary furniture and furnishings are in need of an update and the Deluxe Balcony Room was in need of some TLC as things chipped and/or not working.  The sparse furniture (2 chairs and one small chaise) were uncomfortable.  The outdoor balcony was an enormous deep space with two uncomfortable chairs and a metal sunshade (which could not be moved) hiding the view of Belem Tower.  Despite requesting a quiet room we were still disturbed by train noises until the early morning.  We were not given any information about the pool, restaurants or spa services upon check in.  Also in the outdoor Gastro Bar our credit card was charged in US$ plus a E5 \service surcharge\" added for this - all without asking us."

Just returned from a week at the Vila Gale Tavira in Portugal, the Hotel is very central and within easy reach of shops and restaurants. The Hotel is clean and tidy and the staff are very friendly with nothing too much trouble for them to help you. Buffet breakfast is good with a wide selection to suit all tastes, the bedrooms were very clean and tidy and excellent work by the staff who look after the guest bedroom, always happy and cheerful. Overall the Hotel is excellent and in a good position to use as a base, if I have any criticism it is about the expensive cost from the bar and the lunch bar menu is very bland with very limited items and again quite expensive, but all round this is a good hotel which is clean and tidy, a most enjoyable stay.

We stayed recently with our teenagers. A great hotel. Rooms are lovely, breakfast buffet is excellent. Pool area is clean and there are plenty of sunbeds. Staff are great and also happy to help or answer questions. Tavira is lovely - good selection of bars, and cafes/restaurants. The hotel is near the ferry (costs a couple of euros) to Tavira Island which is definitely worth a visit for the beautiful beaches. We would recommend to people wanting a relaxed holiday in a less touristy area of Portugal.

Dear Pestana teamDespite the fact that some investments into the facility and some service capabilities (too many trainees) are necessary to keep the level high, I want to share my appreciation about our vacation at the pestana viking. The reception is well equiped and very helpful to ease tve da√¨ly life in a foreign country. In particular Mrs Varela was convincing suppotive friendly snd skilled in different languages like English German and Frech. The Restaurant staff (breakfast and bar) was great an also very supportive. Unfortunately, it became too obvious that the Pestana group wants to save money by using too many trainees with reduced skills in the Restaurant. I would likecto pay more and have more professional service. I really loved to see the family friendlyness  of the hotel. The staff was also outstanding here.I really enjoyed our stay.

We had a lovely stay at Sao Lourenco do Barrocal.   The property looks like it may have 200 years ago but the rooms were simple and beautiful with every amenity of a modern hotel.  The staff was professional and accommodating and I got one of the best massages ever (thanks Hannah!).  There is not much to do after you go to the fitness center, get your spa treatments and do a wine tasting (we loved it),  so I recommend coming here at the end of site-seeing through Portugal.   It will be a wonderful place to relax before heading home.

I visited at the Hotel in October for 6 nights.Room was big and clean, big bath, Shower water flow was ok.Breakfast was good and as a vegetarian I asked for the omelets separated from the meet and the guy in the breakfast room refused! that was the FIRST time EVER I was refused to have a separated scramble eggs in all hotels (and B&B). WHEN I MENTIONED it at the reception (very friendly and helpful girl was there) as a \by the way\" that evening she was shocked as well and noted it next to my room number
month: since the I had AUTOMATIC a plate of scramble egg to my table (by the same guy refused to bring at the first morning). Breakfast had lot of fruits
column13: Coffee from machine (I didn't like the coffee) I saw some meat things there as well. No vegetables at all!The place located about 20-25 mins walk to the city center and has a Metro next to it.Internet from the room worked well  (WIFI)."

text: Stayed here last week with a friend. It was perfect. Comfortable,  central, nice staff and amazing breakfast.  In particular,  the staff in the breakfast room were great. So friendly,  helpful and good fun. Great start to the day! Will definitely be back here next time I visit Lisbon!

The worst Villa Gal√© where I have ever stayed1- Paid parking 7.5‚Ç¨ daily2- The Spa can only be used with marking and only 45 minutes daily, Turkish bath was broken as well as a shower that is part of the water circuit3- Rooms with carpet which makes them too hotStrengths:Sympathy and kindness of the entire staffAfter spending a few days in Villa Gal√© Albacora and being in Villa Gal√© Coimbra is to compare the day with the night.Do not recommend this hotel

We enjoyed our 2-night stay as we explored Lisbon area.  The location is great  and located close to a subway stop.  This makes it easy to get around the city.  The rooms are modern and clean.  The bathroom shower is modern and large, by European standards.  The front-desk staff was very nice and helpful.  We were tired on our first night in Lisbon, we decided to just eat at the hotel restaurant - it was ok but nothing memorable. The hotel breakfast was good/average.  I would definitely stay here again.

H√¥tel very well located on the Island, you can move easily from east to west.It is clean, the view from the bedroom is beautiful and you can sleep with the Sound of the waves üôÇWe used the spa ( massage and sauna) which is small but that s enough.We have red a lot of Bads comments about the food so We were pleasantly surprise : the breakfast is great and the meals on the evening are varied and goods !The staff is lovely and always take care of you !We recommended it !

I came with a group of ladies for a 50th birthday celebration.  It was a perfect place to stay.  The guest house is beautiful and tastefully decorated with lovely grounds.  We were made to feel most welcome and all the staff were very helpful and couldn't do enough for us, including arranging celebration drinks and booking a restaurant for our meal.  Will definitely come back

We stayed at this hotel for a week in Lisbon. It is conveniently located within walking distance to two Metro stations and busses. Several good restaurants nearby.The concierge staff was amazingly friendly and helpful whenever we needed assistance with anything. They always greeted us coming and going. The rooms were clean and met all our needs. Clean and sufficient. The balcony was an added bonus, where we could drink our coffee in the sun each day.The breakfast had lots of options available. There were hot choices (scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, hard boiled eggs, toast, etc), and many continental options. The staff in the breakfast area is friendly, clean and attentive.I would stay at this hotel again on my next visit to Lisbon.

This place is absolutely magnificient, with a new added building just next to the older house. Both of them are quite remarkable, very well decorated, and all the atmosphere is really pleasant, with a beautiful garden and pool. The service is excellent, everyone is very kind and they'll show you around as soon as you get there, accompanying you to your room and walking you around as they explained what they've done with the place. The breakfast is great, very complete and with excellent products. The rooms are also very nice and cozy.Overall it was a fantastic experience and we would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting Cascais/Sintra/Estoril.

Stayed at this hostel for 2 nights to start our 2 1/2 week trip. Hostel was always being cleaned, all staff was very friendly, and pub crawl was a blast! My girlfriend and I are vegetarian, so they completely won us over during the group dinner when they prepared veg versions of traditional Portuguese dishes!! Highly recommended!

I visited Myriad Sana Hotel on December 2018. The hotel is located by the river Tagus in an area called Parques de Nacoes which has lots of Gardens, restaurants, malls and the Oceanarium. It is not the ideal location for someone who doesnt want to use hop on hop off busses, taxi, or the metro because it is not in walking distance from the city center and that is its only \problem\".The hotel is newly constructed
month: very modern contemporary and every room provides a stunning view of the river and the city. The rooms are equiped with Nesspresso machine which was excellent
year: a swing chair that was hanging from the sealing
extracted_date_str: nice bathroom and shower and excellent bed! Breakfast was awesome. Gourmet
extracted_date: tasty and special care for people that want to eat gluten free or light.Also you ordered how you wanted your eggs and the chef server them at your table!Also the hotel has 24/7 room service which we used many times!But still the main positive feature of the hotel was the personel! Everybody that worked in Myriad Sana were very helpful
year_int: eager to help you in any way
sentiment_score: truly 5 star treatment!Especially Miguel at guest relations!! Good Job Miguel!!I definately recomend this hotel!To sum up:Negatives:-Not close to city centerPositives-Very well maintained and architectually designed hotel with great room views-Clean spacious rooms
column12: comfortable beds-Amenities-Personel was extremely kind and helpful-Excelent breakfast-24/7 room service-Room price-Truly 5star hotel"

text: Modern and elegant; discreet and lively.Seat in the lounge area and have the Tejo at your feet while having a drink.Attentive service everywhere in the premises.Deserved the prize for best European design.
Amazing tid Jane made the trip with his amazing service in the Mexican. Room service was amazing left the room for 2 minutes and come back to a spotless pad

5 Star service, the bedroom and bathroom super clean and clean, the beds and cushions comfortable, the friendly and helpful staff, I was very well treated during my stay. It has a good spa and piscina interior.You can really rest and sleep well.

We went to Pousada de Viseu for evening tea and it was a very pleasant experience. It was a very good service, in a very beautiful location, where Ismael Almeida's friendliness and availability stand out. To be repeated soon!
Great hotel for fun with friends or to go with the family.Renovated with very good taste. Great staff - all very friendly.The golf course is one of the best in Portugal.Thank you for the hospitality!

From start to finish we had a wonderful and welcoming time in this elegant hotel. The front desk service with my limited Portuguese was wonderfully helpful.The spa is small but warm and well taken care of.The bed is hard, but that makes for a wonderfully pain-free night. I would like for it to not have been just two beds pushed together with completely separate bed-clothes.Dinner was wonderful and romantic, followed by a drink and a game of chess in the gorgeous warm and welcoming bar in the elegant central area of the hotel.
